titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Vanessa Brown Papers, ca. 1950-1988 LSC.1552
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Caroline Cubé, 2002.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-14 11:56:50 -0700.

did.abstract: Vanessa Brown (1928-1999) was born in Vienna, Austria. She appeared in Broadway plays and films. In 1962, she became a writer-coordinator for the Voice of America. The collection contains books, scrapbooks, writings by Brown, and audio recordings.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Vanessa Brown Papers (Collection 1552). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Brown was born on March 24, 1928 in Vienna, Austria; came to the U.S. in 1938; BA, UCLA, 1949; appeared in Broadway plays, As you Like it (1950) and The Seven Year Itch (1952-54); appeared in films, including Youth Runs Wild (1941), The Heiress (1948), and The Bad and the Beautiful (1952); married Mark R. Sandrich, 1959; became writer-coordinator for Voice of America in 1962; correspondent with Los Angeles Times Service, 1970-74, and National Public Radio, 1973-74; writer, KTLA-TV, 1972-74; worked for presidential campaigns of Adlai Stevenson, 1956, and John F. Kennedy, 1960; artist with one-woman show at Edgardo Costa Gallery, Beverly Hills, California; founder, American Acting Company. She died on May 21, 1999 in Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains bibliographical reference works and other books in which Vanessa Brown is mentioned. Also includes scrapbooks, writings by Brown, and audio tapes of Voice of America broadcasts.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is in the order determined by the previous archivist.

controlaccess.occupation: Motion picture actors and actresses -- California -- Los Angeles -- Archives.
Women radio writers -- United States -- Archives.

did.unittitle: His Way: The Unauthorized Biography Of Frank Sinatra. by Kitty Kelley (Toronto: Bantam Books)
Murrow: His Life And Times by A.M. Sperber (New York: Freundlich Books) [inscribed by author]
The Papers Of Adlai E. Stevenson. vol.6., edited by Walter Johnson (Boston and Toronto: Little, Brown and Company)
The Theatre In The Fifties by George Jean Nathan (New York: Alfred A. Knopf)
Whatever Happened To The Quiz Kids? by Ruth Duskin Feldman (Chicago: Chicago Review Press) [inscribed by author]
Photocopies of published biographical references to Vanessa Brown

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Forty audio cassettes marked with dates and times of classes, the nature of which is unknown.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: FILE CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this file will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: U-matic videocassette "What To Be: a medley of six programs."

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: FILE CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this file will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes clippings and programs for a touring production of As You Like It starring Katharine Hepburn.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: BOX CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this box will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains: list of radio reports and interviews by Vanessa Brown; thirteen reel-to-reel tapes; interviewees include Robert Kennedy, Adlai Stevenson, and Billy Wilder.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: BOX CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this box will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains fifteen reel-to-reel tapes; interviewees and topics include Eleanor Roosevelt, Carl Sandburg, Adlai Stevenson, and Marietta Tree.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: BOX CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this box will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains fourteen reel-to-reel tapes; interviewees include Walter Reuther and Adlai Stevenson.

did.unittitle: "The Voice of America -- Where It Stands" [speech by Vanessa Brown]
What Do You Want To Be Tomorrow? [career-guidance workshop]
In My Father's House [manuscript by Vanessa Brown]
Vocal Selections from Ben Franklin in Paris by Mark Sandrich, Jr. and Sidney Michaels [photocopy]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photocopies of photographs, drawings by Brown, pin-up from Esquire, Life, March 9, 1953 [with Brown on cover].
